title: Creating a reading list on machine reasoning involves selecting articles that cover a range of topics within the field, including foundational theories, applications, and recent advancements. Here is a list of 20 articles up to 2020 that you might find useful
**"A Survey of Automated Theorem Proving"** by Larry Wos et al
- A foundational paper discussing early developments in automated reasoning
- A comprehensive book that covers the logical underpinnings of AI, including reasoning
- Discusses the concept of the knowledge level in AI, which is crucial for understanding reasoning systems
**"Reasoning about Knowledge"** by Ronald Fagin et al
- A seminal book on the formalization of knowledge and reasoning in multi-agent systems
**"Probabilistic Reasoning in Intelligent Systems: Networks of Plausible Inference"** by Judea Pearl (1988) - Introduces Bayesian networks and their use in reasoning under uncertainty
- Discusses conceptual graphs as a means of knowledge representation and reasoning
**"The Description Logic Handbook: Theory, Implementation, and Applications"** by Franz Baader et al
- Covers description logics, which are key to reasoning in semantic web technologies
- An overview of answer set programming, a form of declarative programming oriented towards difficult search problems
**"The DLV System for Knowledge Representation and Reasoning"** by Nicola Leone et al
- Discusses the DLV system, which is used for knowledge representation and reasoning
**"Automated Planning: Theory and Practice"** by Malik Ghallab et al
- Covers planning algorithms, which are essential for reasoning about actions and change
**"Reasoning with Conditional Ceteris Paribus Preference Statements"** by Craig Boutilier et al
- Discusses reasoning with preferences, which is important in decision-making systems
**"A Survey of Tractable Reasoning and Efficient Querying in Description Logics"** by Franz Baader et al
- Reviews efficient reasoning techniques in description logics
- A comprehensive textbook on the principles of knowledge representation and reasoning
**"The Cognitive Dimensions of Notations"** by Thomas R.G
- Discusses the cognitive aspects of notations used in reasoning systems
**"A Logic for Default Reasoning"** by Raymond Reiter
- Introduces default logic, a formalism for reasoning with default assumptions
**"The Stable Model Semantics for Logic Programming"** by Michael Gelfond and Vladimir Lifschitz (1988) - Discusses the stable model semantics, which is foundational for non-monotonic reasoning
**"Formalizing Common Sense: Papers by John McCarthy"** by John McCarthy
- A collection of papers by one of the pioneers of AI, focusing on formalizing common sense reasoning

container-title: **"The Frame Problem in Artificial Intelligence: Proceedings of the 1987 Workshop"**
title: - Discusses the frame problem, a central issue in reasoning about action and change
**"On the Logic of Theory Change: Partial Meet Contraction and Revision Functions"** by Carlos Alchourrón
- Introduces the AGM theory of belief revision, important for reasoning about knowledge updates
**"A Survey of the Usages of Formal Ontologies"** by Nicola Guarino (1998) - Discusses the role of ontologies in reasoning systems
These articles and books provide a broad overview of the field of machine reasoning, covering both theoretical foundations and practical applications
